note.p: Death: At his cottage on the banks of the River Exe, Devon (08 October 1808)

Career: Taught anatomy at Watson's private museum, Tottenham Court Road, London; opened a private anatomical theatre, taught and researched there, in Great Queen Street, London (1777); Professor of Anatomy, Royal Academy (1782); Surgeon, Westminster Hospital (1786-1788); Surgeon, Devon and Exeter Hospital (1797)
